definition:
A subgraph $B$ of a graph $G$ is a *block of* $G$ if either it is a
bridge (together with the vertices incident with the bridge) or else it
is a maximal 2-connected subgraph of $G$.

Any two blocks of a graph $G$ have at most one vertex in common. Also,
every vertex belonging to at least two blocks is a cutvertex of $G$,
and, conversely, every cutvertex belongs to at least two blocks.
